title: Coming to a school near you
description: At Austin’s Alpha School, students spend just two hours a day on academics, led by artificial intelligence tools.

title: Bill to criminalise AI child abuse apps to be introduced to parliament
description: MP Kate Chaney is set to introduce a bill to criminalise the use of AI tools purpose-built to create child sexual abuse material, with the independent saying the urgent issue cannot wait for the government's wider response to artificial intelligence.
content:
A bill to criminalise the use of AI tools purpose-built to create child sexual abuse material is set to be introduced to parliament.

title: The US and China will go head-to-head in the battle to bring about artificial general intelligence
description: The AI battle between China and the US is less about profits and return on investment, and more about geopolitics — national machismo, security and defence.
content:
Artificial intelligence is no longer just a race among a group of over-valued American tech companies and over-yachted billionaires.
It's still that, but it's now also part of the great contest between the US and China.
That means it's less about pro... [8410 chars]

title: Spanish teenager investigated over AI naked images of classmates
description: MADRID - Spanish police said on Sunday they were investigating a 17-year-old on suspicion of using artificial intelligence to deepfake nude images of female classmates for sale. Read more at straitstimes.com.
content:
MADRID - Spanish police said on Sunday they were investigating a 17-year-old on suspicion of using artificial intelligence to deepfake nude images of female classmates for sale.

title: UN tech chief wants AI regulated
description: GENEVA – The world urgently needs to find a global approach on regulating artificial intelligence, the United Nations’ top tech chief said this week,
content:

title: Urgent need for 'global approach' on AI regulation: UN tech chief
description: The world urgently needs to find a global approach on regulating artificial intelligence, the United Nations' top tech chief said this week, warning that fragmentation could deepen risks and inequalities.Without a concerted effort, there is a risk that AI will end up standing for "advancing inequalities", she warned, cautioning against deepening an already dire digital divide worldwide.
content:

title: TCS to cut 12,000 jobs this year amid AI disruption, weak demand
description: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) plans to lay off around 12,000 employees, about 2% of its global workforce, over 2025, primarily targeting mid- and senior-level roles. The company cites the need to become 'future-ready' amid economic uncertainty and disruptions caused by artificial intelligence.
